query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 «Vexilla regis prodeunt inferni 2 verso di noi; però dinanzi mira», 3 disse ’l maestro mio, «se tu ’l discerni».
query.result:
**English:**
1 "The banners of the king of hell advance 2 towards us; but look ahead," 3 said my master, "if you can make them out."
**Malay:**
1 "Panji-panji raja neraka bergerak maju 2 ke arah kita; tetapi lihatlah ke depan," 3 kata tuanku, "jika kamu dapat melihatnya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
4 Come quando una grossa nebbia spira, 5 o quando l’emisperio nostro annotta, 6 par di lungi un molin che ’l vento gira,
7 veder mi parve un tal dificio allotta; 8 poi per lo vento mi ristrinsi retro 9 al duca mio, ché non lì era altra grotta.
query.result:
**English:**
4 As when a thick fog blows, 5 or when our hemisphere darkens at night, 6 it seems from afar that a mill is turning in the wind,
7 I thought I saw such a structure then; 8 then because of the wind I drew back behind 9 my guide, for there was no other shelter there.
**Malay:**
4 Seperti ketika kabut tebal bertiup, 5 atau ketika belahan bumi kita menjadi gelap di malam hari, 6 tampak dari jauh sebuah kincir angin yang berputar,
7 kupikir kulihat bangunan seperti itu saat itu; 8 kemudian karena angin aku mundur ke belakang 9 pemanduku, karena tidak ada tempat berlindung lain di sana.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
10 Già era, e con paura il metto in metro, 11 là dove l’ombre tutte eran coperte, 12 e trasparien come festuca in vetro.
query.result:
**English:**
10 It was already, and with fear I put it into verse, 11 there where all the shadows were covered, 12 and shone through like a straw in glass.
**Malay:**
10 Saat itu, dan dengan rasa takut aku memasukkannya ke dalam syair, 11 di sana di mana semua bayangan tertutup, 12 dan bersinar seperti jerami di kaca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
13 Altre sono a giacere; altre stanno erte, 14 quella col capo e quella con le piante; 15 altra, com’ arco, il volto a’ piè rinverte.
query.result:
**English:**
13 Others lie on the ground; others stand upright, 14 some with their heads up and some with their feet up; 15 another, like a bow, bends its face toward its feet.
**Malay:**
13 Ada yang terbaring; ada yang berdiri tegak, 14 ada yang dengan kepala di atas dan ada yang dengan kaki di atas; 15 yang lain, seperti busur, membengkokkan wajahnya ke arah kakinya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 Quando noi fummo fatti tanto avante, 17 ch’al mio maestro piacque di mostrarmi 18 la creatura ch’ebbe il bel sembiante,
19 d’innanzi mi si tolse e fé restarmi, 20 «Ecco Dite», dicendo, «ed ecco il loco 21 ove convien che di fortezza t’armi».
query.result:
**English:**
16 When we had gone so far forward, 17 that it pleased my master to show me 18 the creature that had the beautiful form,
19 he removed himself from before me and made me stop, 20 saying, "Behold Dite," and "behold the place 21 where it is necessary for you to arm yourself with strength."
**Malay:**
16 Ketika kami telah pergi begitu jauh ke depan, 17 sehingga tuanku senang untuk menunjukkan kepadaku 18 makhluk yang memiliki rupa yang cantik,
19 ia menyingkir dari hadapanku dan membuatku berhenti, 20 berkata, "Lihatlah Dite," dan "lihatlah tempat 21 di mana kamu harus mempersenjatai dirimu dengan kekuatan."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
22 Com’ io divenni allor gelato e fioco, 23 nol dimandar, lettor, ch’i’ non lo scrivo, 24 però ch’ogne parlar sarebbe poco.
query.result:
**English:**
22 How I became frozen and faint then, 23 do not ask me, reader, for I do not write it, 24 because all speech would be feeble.
**Malay:**
22 Bagaimana aku menjadi beku dan pingsan saat itu, 23 jangan tanya aku, pembaca, karena aku tidak menuliskannya, 24 karena semua perkataan akan sia-sia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 Io non mori’ e non rimasi vivo; 26 pensa oggimai per te, s’hai fior d’ingegno, 27 qual io divenni, d’uno e d’altro privo.
query.result:
**English:**
25 I did not die, and I did not remain alive; 26 now think for yourself, if you have a spark of genius, 27 what I became, deprived of both one and the other.
**Malay:**
25 Aku tidak mati dan tidak tetap hidup; 26 pikirkanlah sekarang untuk dirimu sendiri, jika kamu memiliki percikan kecerdasan, 27 bagaimana keadaanku, kehilangan keduanya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 Lo ’mperador del doloroso regno 29 da mezzo ’l petto uscia fuor de la ghiaccia; 30 e più con un gigante io mi convegno,
31 che i giganti non fan con le sue braccia: 32 vedi oggimai quant’ esser dee quel tutto 33 ch’a così fatta parte si confaccia.
query.result:
**English:**
28 The emperor of the sorrowful kingdom 29 emerged from the ice up to the middle of his chest; 30 and I interact more with a giant
31 than giants do with his arms: 32 now you can see how large that whole must be 33 to be proportionate to such a part.
**Malay:**
28 Maharaja kerajaan yang menyedihkan itu 29 keluar dari es hingga ke tengah dadanya; 30 dan aku lebih banyak berinteraksi dengan seorang raksasa
31 daripada para raksasa berinteraksi dengan lengannya: 32 sekarang kamu dapat melihat seberapa besar keseluruhan itu 33 yang sepadan dengan bagian seperti itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 S’el fu sì bel com’ elli è ora brutto, 35 e contra ’l suo fattore alzò le ciglia, 36 ben dee da lui procedere ogne lutto.
query.result:
**English:**
34 If he was as beautiful as he is now ugly, 35 and raised his eyebrows against his creator, 36 then every sorrow must proceed from him.
**Malay:**
34 Jika dia seindah dia sekarang jelek, 35 dan mengangkat alisnya melawan penciptanya, 36 maka setiap kesedihan pasti berasal darinya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 Oh quanto parve a me gran maraviglia 38 quand’ io vidi tre facce a la sua testa! 39 L’una dinanzi, e quella era vermiglia;
40 l’altr’ eran due, che s’aggiugnieno a questa 41 sovresso ’l mezzo di ciascuna spalla, 42 e sé giugnieno al loco de la cresta:
43 e la destra parea tra bianca e gialla; 44 la sinistra a vedere era tal, quali 45 vegnon di là onde ’l Nilo s’avvalla.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Oh, how great a marvel it seemed to me 38 when I saw three faces on his head! 39 The one in front, and that was crimson;
40 the other two, which joined this one 41 above the middle of each shoulder, 42 and met at the place of the crest:
43 and the right one seemed between white and yellow; 44 the left one, to see it, was such 45 as those that come from where the Nile descends.
**Malay:**
37 Oh, betapa hebatnya keajaiban yang tampak bagiku 38 ketika aku melihat tiga wajah di kepalanya! 39 Yang satu di depan, dan itu berwarna merah;
40 yang lainnya ada dua, yang bergabung dengan yang ini 41 di atas bagian tengah dari masing-masing bahu, 42 dan bertemu di tempat puncak kepala:
43 dan yang kanan tampak antara putih dan kuning; 44 yang kiri, untuk melihatnya, adalah seperti itu, 45 seperti yang datang dari tempat Sungai Nil mengalir.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
46 Sotto ciascuna uscivan due grand’ ali, 47 quanto si convenia a tanto uccello: 48 vele di mar non vid’ io mai cotali.
query.result:
**English:**
46 Beneath each one emerged two mighty wings, 47 as befitting such a bird: 48 I never saw sails on the sea like them.
**Malay:**
46 Di bawah masing-masing keluar dua sayap yang besar, 47 sebagaimana layaknya burung sebesar itu: 48 layar kapal di laut tidak pernah kulihat seperti itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
49 Non avean penne, ma di vispistrello 50 era lor modo; e quelle svolazzava, 51 sì che tre venti si movean da ello:
52 quindi Cocito tutto s’aggelava.
query.result:
**English:**
49 They had no wings, but like a bat's 50 was their fashion; and they fluttered them, 51 so that three winds were stirred up by them:
52 Cocytus was frozen all over by this.
**Malay:**
49 Mereka tidak mempunyai sayap, tetapi seperti kelelawar 50 adalah cara mereka; dan mereka mengepakkannya, 51 sehingga tiga angin bergerak karenanya:
52 Oleh itu, Cocytus membeku seluruhnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
53 Con sei occhi piangëa, e per tre menti 54 gocciava ’l pianto e sanguinosa bava.
55 Da ogne bocca dirompea co’ denti 56 un peccatore, a guisa di maciulla, 57 sì che tre ne facea così dolenti.
query.result:
**English:**
53 With six eyes he wept, and down three chins 54 the tears and bloody foam ran down.
55 At every mouth he crushed a sinner 56 with his teeth, like a flax-brake, 57 so that he made three of them suffer thus.
**Malay:**
53 Dengan enam mata dia menangis, dan di tiga dagu 54 tetesan air mata dan air liur berdarah mengalir.
55 Dari setiap mulut dia menghancurkan seorang pendosa 56 dengan giginya, seperti pemecah rami, 57 sehingga dia membuat tiga dari mereka menderita seperti itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 A quel dinanzi il mordere era nulla 59 verso ’l graffiar, che talvolta la schiena 60 rimanea de la pelle tutta brulla.
query.result:
**English:**
58 Compared to the biting, the scratching was nothing 59 in front of him, which sometimes left 60 the back completely bare of skin.
**Malay:**
58 Dibandingkan dengan gigitan, cakaran tidak ada apa-apanya 59 di depannya, yang terkadang membuat 60 punggung benar-benar tanpa kulit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 «Quell’ anima là sù c’ha maggior pena», 62 disse ’l maestro, «è Giuda Scarïotto, 63 che ’l capo ha dentro e fuor le gambe mena.
query.result:
**English:**
61 "That soul up there who suffers the greatest pain," 62 said the master, "is Judas Iscariot, 63 whose head is inside and whose legs kick outside.
**Malay:**
61 "Jiwa di sana yang menderita kesakitan terbesar," 62 kata sang guru, "adalah Yudas Iskariot, 63 yang kepalanya ada di dalam dan kakinya menendang di luar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
68 Ma la notte risurge, e oramai 69 è da partir, ché tutto avem veduto».
70 Com’ a lui piacque, il collo li avvinghiai; 71 ed el prese di tempo e loco poste, 72 e quando l’ali fuoro aperte assai,
73 appigliò sé a le vellute coste; 74 di vello in vello giù discese poscia 75 tra ’l folto pelo e le gelate croste.
query.result:
**English:**
68 But night is rising, and it is time to leave, 69 for we have seen everything.
70 As he wished, I put my arms around his neck; 71 and he chose the right time and place, 72 and when his wings were spread wide,
73 he clung to the hairy sides; 74 he then descended from hair to hair 75 between the thick fur and the icy crusts.
**Malay:**
68 Tetapi malam mulai bangkit, dan sekarang 69 saatnya untuk berangkat, karena kita telah melihat semuanya.
70 Seperti yang diinginkannya, aku melingkarkan lenganku di lehernya; 71 dan dia memilih waktu dan tempat yang tepat, 72 dan ketika sayapnya terbuka lebar,
73 dia menempel pada sisi-sisi yang berbulu; 74 dia kemudian turun dari bulu ke bulu 75 di antara bulu yang tebal dan kerak es.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 Quando noi fummo là dove la coscia 77 si volge, a punto in sul grosso de l’anche, 78 lo duca, con fatica e con angoscia,
79 volse la testa ov’ elli avea le zanche, 80 e aggrappossi al pel com’ om che sale, 81 sì che ’n inferno i’ credea tornar anche.
query.result:
**English:**
76 When we were there where the thigh 77 turns, at the point exactly on the thick part of the haunch, 78 the leader, with effort and with anguish,
79 turned his head where he had his legs, 80 and clutched the hair like a man who climbs, 81 so that I thought I was returning to hell again.
**Malay:**
76 Ketika kami berada di tempat paha 77 berbelok, tepat di bagian tebal pangkal paha, 78 sang pemimpin, dengan susah payah dan kesedihan,
79 menoleh ke tempat kakinya berada, 80 dan mencengkeram bulu seperti orang yang memanjat, 81 sehingga kupikir aku akan kembali ke neraka lagi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
82 «Attienti ben, ché per cotali scale», 83 disse ’l maestro, ansando com’ uom lasso, 84 «conviensi dipartir da tanto male».
query.result:
**English:**
82 "Pay close attention, for by such stairs," 83 said the master, panting like a weary man, 84 "one must depart from so much evil."
**Malay:**
82 "Perhatikan baik-baik, karena melalui tangga seperti ini," 83 kata sang guru, terengah-engah seperti orang yang lelah, 84 "kita harus meninggalkan kejahatan yang begitu banyak ini."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 Poi uscì fuor per lo fóro d’un sasso 86 e puose me in su l’orlo a sedere; 87 appresso porse a me l’accorto passo.
query.result:
**English:**
85 Then he went out through the opening of a rock 86 and made me sit down on the edge; 87 then he offered me the cautious step.
**Malay:**
85 Kemudian dia keluar melalui celah sebuah batu 86 dan menyuruhku duduk di tepi; 87 lalu dia menawarkan langkah hati-hati kepadaku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
94 «Lèvati sù», disse ’l maestro, «in piede: 95 la via è lunga e ’l cammino è malvagio, 96 e già il sole a mezza terza riede».
query.result:
**English:**
94 "Get up," said the master, "on your feet: 95 the way is long and the path is treacherous, 96 and already the sun is returning to mid-morning."
**Malay:**
94 "Bangunlah," kata sang guru, "berdirilah: 95 jalannya panjang dan perjalanannya berbahaya, 96 dan matahari sudah kembali ke tengah pagi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
97 Non era camminata di palagio 98 là ’v’ eravam, ma natural burella 99 ch’avea mal suolo e di lume disagio.
query.result:
**English:**
97 It was not a walk in the park, 98 where we were, but a natural sinkhole 99 that had bad ground and a lack of light.
**Malay:**
97 Bukanlah perjalanan di taman, 98 di tempat kami berada, tetapi lubang pembuangan alami 99 yang tanahnya jelek dan kurang cahaya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 «Prima ch’io de l’abisso mi divella, 101 maestro mio», diss’ io quando fui dritto, 102 «a trarmi d’erro un poco mi favella:
103 ov’ è la ghiaccia? e questi com’ è fitto 104 sì sottosopra? e come, in sì poc’ ora, 105 da sera a mane ha fatto il sol tragitto?».
query.result:
**English:**
100 “Before I pull myself out of the abyss, 101 my master,” I said when I was upright, 102 “speak to me a little to free me from error:
103 where is the ice? and how is it that this one is fixed 104 upside down? and how, in such a short time, 105 has the sun made its journey from evening to morning?”
**Malay:**
100 “Sebelum aku menarik diriku keluar dari jurang, 101 guruku,” kataku ketika aku berdiri tegak, 102 “bicaralah sedikit kepadaku untuk membebaskanku dari kesalahan:
103 di manakah es? dan bagaimana mungkin yang ini tertancap 104 terbalik? dan bagaimana, dalam waktu yang begitu singkat, 105 matahari telah melakukan perjalanannya dari senja hingga pagi?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
106 Ed elli a me: «Tu imagini ancora 107 d’esser di là dal centro, ov’ io mi presi 108 al pel del vermo reo che ’l mondo fóra.
query.result:
**English:**
106 And he to me: "You still imagine 107 to be on the other side of the center, where I took 108 the hair of the wicked worm that pierced the world.
**Malay:**
106 Dan dia kepadaku: "Kamu masih membayangkan 107 berada di seberang pusat, di mana aku mengambil 108 bulu cacing jahat yang menusuk dunia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Di là fosti cotanto quant’ io scesi; 110 quand’ io mi volsi, tu passasti ’l punto 111 al qual si traggon d’ogne parte i pesi.
query.result:
**English:**
109 There you were as long as I descended; 110 when I turned, you passed the point 111 to which all weights are drawn from every side.
**Malay:**
109 Di sana engkau berada selama aku turun; 110 ketika aku berbalik, engkau melewati titik 111 yang ke sana semua beban ditarik dari setiap sisi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
112 E se’ or sotto l’emisperio giunto 113 ch’è contraposto a quel che la gran secca 114 coverchia, e sotto ’l cui colmo consunto
115 fu l’uom che nacque e visse sanza pecca; 116 tu haï i piedi in su picciola spera 117 che l’altra faccia fa de la Giudecca.
query.result:
**English:**
112 And if you have now reached the hemisphere 113 that is opposite to the one that the great expanse of dry land 114 covers, and beneath whose summit he was conceived 115 who was born and lived without sin; 116 you have your feet on a small sphere 117 that forms the other face of Judea.
**Malay:**
112 Dan jika kamu sekarang telah sampai di hemisfera 113 yang berlawanan dengan yang diselimuti oleh hamparan tanah kering yang luas, 114 dan di bawah puncaknya dilahirkanlah manusia 115 yang lahir dan hidup tanpa dosa; 116 kamu memiliki kaki di atas bola kecil 117 yang membentuk sisi lain dari Yudea.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 Qui è da man, quando di là è sera; 119 e questi, che ne fé scala col pelo, 120 fitto è ancora sì come prim’ era.
query.result:
**English:**
118 Here it is morning, while there it is evening; 119 and he who made a ladder for us with his hair, 120 is still fixed in the same way as he was before.
**Malay:**
118 Di sini adalah pagi, sementara di sana adalah petang; 119 dan dia yang membuat tangga untuk kita dengan rambutnya, 120 masih tetap seperti sebelumnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 Da questa parte cadde giù dal cielo; 122 e la terra, che pria di qua si sporse, 123 per paura di lui fé del mar velo,
124 e venne a l’emisperio nostro; e forse 125 per fuggir lui lasciò qui loco vòto 126 quella ch’appar di qua, e sù ricorse».
query.result:
**English:**
121 From this side he fell down from heaven; 122 and the earth, which had previously jutted out here, 123 out of fear of him made a veil of the sea,
124 and came to our hemisphere; and perhaps 125 to flee from him that one which appears here left this place empty, 126 and ran back up.
**Malay:**
121 Dari sisi ini dia jatuh dari langit; 122 dan bumi, yang sebelumnya menjorok ke luar di sini, 123 karena takut padanya membuat laut sebagai tabir,
124 dan datang ke belahan bumi kita; dan mungkin 125 untuk melarikan diri darinya yang satu itu yang muncul di sini meninggalkan tempat ini kosong, 126 dan berlari kembali ke atas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 Luogo è là giù da Belzebù remoto 128 tanto quanto la tomba si distende, 129 che non per vista, ma per suono è noto
130 d’un ruscelletto che quivi discende 131 per la buca d’un sasso, ch’elli ha roso, 132 col corso ch’elli avvolge, e poco pende.
query.result:
**English:**
127 The place is down there, far from Beelzebub, 128 as far as the tomb extends, 129 which is known not by sight, but by sound,
130 of a streamlet that descends there 131 through the hole of a rock, which it has gnawed, 132 with its winding course, and it slopes a little.
**Malay:**
127 Tempat itu berada di bawah sana, jauh dari Beelzebub, 128 sejauh kuburan itu terbentang, 129 yang tidak diketahui melalui penglihatan, tetapi melalui suara,
130 dari sungai kecil yang turun di sana 131 melalui lubang batu, yang telah digerogotinya, 132 dengan alirannya yang berkelok-kelok, dan sedikit menurun.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
133 Lo duca e io per quel cammino ascoso 134 intrammo a ritornar nel chiaro mondo; 135 e sanza cura aver d’alcun riposo,
136 salimmo sù, el primo e io secondo, 137 tanto ch’i’ vidi de le cose belle 138 che porta ’l ciel, per un pertugio tondo.
query.result:
**English:**
133 The leader and I, by that hidden path, 134 entered to return to the bright world; 135 and without caring to have any rest,
136 we climbed up, he first and I second, 137 so much that I saw of the beautiful things 138 that heaven bears, through a round opening.
**Malay:**
133 Pemimpin dan aku, melalui jalan tersembunyi itu, 134 masuk untuk kembali ke dunia yang terang; 135 dan tanpa peduli untuk beristirahat,
136 kami memanjat, dia yang pertama dan aku yang kedua, 137 sehingga aku melihat banyak hal indah 138 yang dibawa oleh langit, melalui lubang bundar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
139 E quindi uscimmo a riveder le stelle.
query.result:
**English:**
139 And so we emerged to see the stars again.
**Malay:**
139 Dan begitulah kami keluar untuk melihat bintang-bintang lagi.
